bug.summary: Per-thread data could be released from a different thread
bug.text: This caused problems in some situations. Per-thread data is now always released from the thread it belongs to.
Trying to redefine built-in CORBA module types led to a segfault instead of an error.
Multiple threads creating and destroying POAs could conflict.
A problem with condition variable handling meant that a worker thread could add itself to the idle list more than once, leading to a later crash.
Floating point values could become corrupted upon marshalling with some compilers. This is due to strict aliasing interacting with the optimiser.
Shutdown suffered from a number of problems, especially on Windows.
Threads waiting for a main thread dispatch could block for ever.
